IrmaDialogue2: ^Whoa, I did NOT need this many!
^I should've specified what size I needed. Gosh.
^Anyway, thanks a bunch! I'll install your upgrade, as promised.

g-0: ^Sorry, it's just that I was waiting for someone to come get it and...
g-1: ^Are you the one who wrote this letter?
^[You hand the letter over to Irma, who perks up at the sight of it.]
^Gosh, I can't believe it actually reached you. It's been so long!
g-2: ^If you're the one who found this boat, does that mean you know where my parents might've gone?
^Oh, I'm not the one who found it! I just wrote you the letter!
^And I'm sorry to say, I don't know anything about your parents' whereabouts.
^She disappeared a while back... I haven't seen her for years now.
^When the others found your parents' boat, I thought that something might've happened to the owners.
^I mean, you can't exactly leave the archipelago without a boat.
^But at the same time, there's no trace of them still being here. Neither my sister nor your parents.
^I was thinking... maybe their disappearances are related?
^Agh, I don't know... it's just that this archipelago is so weird, anything could've happened!
^I tried to ask the others if they knew anything, but they play dumb.
g-3: ^What do you mean, they play dumb? What if they really don't know?
^Some of them have been here their whole lives, and those who haven't have lived here longer than I have!
^It's just weird that people are going missing and apparently no one notices anything strange going on.
^I don't suspect them, mind you. I just can't shake the feeling they're keeping something from me.
^... I'm guessing you oughta get going soon.
^If you find out anything regarding your parents, talk to me before anyone else.
^I just want to make sure I'm not missing out on something that could lead me to my sister.
g-4: ^Okay. I'll let you know any information I find.
^Thank you! Really, thank you so much!
^I gotta head back inside now, but please, talk to me whenever!
